trans-unit.target:
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_00<tab>Fahrafahr seems pleased with how work is coming along─most of it, anyway.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_01<tab>With the first step of the Zirgorteh of the Open-armed's restoration complete, Fahrafahr has already moved on to the next. She and the Hands have begun building a workshop wherein Yok Huy masons can craft stone using their traditional methods, but it seems progress has come to halt. Fahrafahr is sparse on the details, but asks you to follow her and meet the stonemason Girzorhor to find out what the problem is.
※Please note that you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_02<tab>You meet the stonemason Girzorhor, who seems to have been stricken by an immobilizing fear. You search for the right words to /soothe his troubled heart.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_03<tab>At your calming words, Girzorhor regains his composure long enough to tell you that a group of snow spirits attacked him while he was working. Bemoaning the hazardous conditions of his workplace, the stonemason practically flees from the mountain. However, Fahrafahr is determined to make him see reason, as his knowledge is essential to building the workshop. She asks you to accompany her, and together you descend to Worlar's Echo.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_04<tab>In an effort to allay Girzorhor's fears, Fahrafahr tells him Dartorgor's tale─how she was the sole keeper of the Breathless Altar and kept the spirits appeased with the Pact. You also pitch in to remind him how vital the work being done is, and Girzorhor is impressed by the courage of company both past and present. Seemingly at ease, he agrees to help the Hands of Zirgorteh again, but confesses that he lost some of his tools in his flight from the spirits. Luckily, a capable artisan is close at hand, and Fahrafahr asks you to create tools to replace the lost ones.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_05<tab>You deliver the tools to Girzorhor, and inspired by the quality of your work, he returns to Zirgorteh the Open-armed with a newfound sense of purpose. Fahrafahr commends you on your work, but must return to resume her own tasks. She asks you to visit with her next time you make the trek up the mountain pass.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SEQ_06<tab>It seems Girzorhor's inspiration was such that by the time you return to Zirgorteh the Open-armed, the workshop is already complete. Now that they can create the traditional stonework of the Yok Huy, the Hands of Zirgorteh are ready to rebuild in earnest. Proud to have honored the memory of her mentor, Fahrafahr encourages you to hone your skills for when next step in their project begins.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Fahrafahr at Zirgorteh the Open-armed.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_TODO_01<tab>/soothe Girzorhor.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Girzorhor in Worlar's Echo.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_TODO_03<tab><var 08 E4E8050A ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E8050B ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E8050C ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E80509 ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E8050D ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E8050E ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E8050F ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E4E80510 ((<var 08 E3E802E803 ((Synthesize <var 31 ((Item)) 02E8060202 /var>)) ((Deliver <var 31 ((Item)) 03E8060202 /var> to Girzorhor)) /var>)) (()) /var>)) /var>)) /var>)) /var>)) /var>)) /var>)) /var>)) /var>.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Fahrafahr.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_001<tab>Your work thus far has been greatly appreciated, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Each time I look upon our progress I am impressed anew at everyone's diligence.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_002<tab>In fact, we have already moved on to our next step: building the stonemasons' workshop.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_100_002<tab>It will be essential to restoring the Breathless Altar to its former grandeur. Each stone that was swept away must be made again─in the traditional Yok Huy fashion, no less.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_003<tab>Such is the way for all of our ceremonial spaces. And since transporting so much stone from Worlar's Echo would only result in broken bricks and sore backs, the workshop will be our most vital project yet.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_004<tab>I have entrusted its construction to a skilled mason named Girzorhor, and work was proceeding apace until a certain...incident occurred. I have yet to hear the details, but it seems progress has stalled.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_005<tab>I mean to go and speak with him, and would be grateful if you could accompany me. It might be easier to solve whatever problem awaits us if we tackle it together.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_010<tab>No, this is too much... I must leave!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_100<tab>Here we are, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. This is Girzorhor, and as you can see he is...distraught.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_101<tab>My words do not seem to reach him. I know not what has happened, only that he is intent on leaving.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_102<tab>Perhaps a softer voice than mine might <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soothe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> his fright. Might you give it a try, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_105<tab>No, this is too much... I must leave!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_110<tab>Girzorhor is trembling with fear. Try to <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>soothe<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> his troubled heart.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_115<tab>My words seem to have no effect on him, but perhaps he would listen to a more soothing voice. Please try, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_200<tab>Ah, apologies for ignoring you before. I was panicked, and barely aware of my surroundings. I...should probably explain why.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_201<tab>While I was going about my tasks for the day, I caught sight of one of the snow spirits. It pranced about playfully and approached...then pelted me with icy magick!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_202<tab>I managed to flee before I was impaled by a frozen spear, but now that I have seen the extent of their wrath, I cannot risk my life working here!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_203<tab>I warned everyone to be wary of the spirits, but it seems I failed to convey just how dangerous they could be.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_204<tab>And while I understand Girzorhor's fear, this attack only emphasizes how crucial it is for us to complete restoration of the altar─and for that, we need his expertise.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_205<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, would you come with me to Worlar's Echo to help convince our mason to return? There must be some way to sway him.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_210<tab>I tried reasoning with him, but he seems set on staying put. Perhaps you can make him see how crucial he is to our work.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_300<tab>Oh, I remember you. Apologies, but if you mean to convince me to climb back up that mountain, I must refuse.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_Q2_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_A2_000_001<tab>Why did you let the spirits get so close?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_A2_000_002<tab>Remember the importance of our work. All of Urqopacha depends on it.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_100_300<tab>It was as I said. The spirits seemed inviting...but then their mood turned foul so quickly.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_110_300<tab>But...but I understand now. If I was taken by surprise so easily, others might be as well. That is precisely why we must restore the altar, is it not?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_120_300<tab>All of Urqopacha? I know the altar and ceremony are meant to appease the spirits, but...
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_130_300<tab>I...I understand now. If I was taken by surprise so easily, others might be as well. That is what we work for, do we not? To restore peace to Urqopacha.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_301<tab>Yes...I understand your point. Yet the very memory of that terrible moment sends a chill down my spine that keeps my legs firmly planted here.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_302<tab>I understand your feelings, Girzorhor. I feel them, too. Yet Dartorgor was courageous in the face of all that─and so must we be.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_303<tab>Dartorgor? Ah, the one who lived in the mountains before the avalanche.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_304<tab>Yes. She once told me that the spirits had been there since ancient times, and wrought calamity upon any who dared to encroach upon their home.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_305<tab>When our forebears settled there, they were battered by avalanches and snowstorms...until they performed the Pact for the first time.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_306<tab>Ever since, the ritual and the altar it is performed upon served as the foundation for a peaceful coexistence with the spirits.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_307<tab>Dartorgor bore that responsibility alone for many years, keeping disaster at bay. Yet she is with us no longer, and someone must follow in her footsteps. <var 1A 02 /var>I<var 1A 01 /var> must follow.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_308<tab>You take on this burden, even knowing full well the danger it poses?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_309<tab>Dartorgor would have wanted it this way. When she would descend from her home, she would stay with me. I treasure each and every one of those memories.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_DARTORGOR_000_310<tab>(-Dartorgor-)You really must see how Ryoqor Terteh and the other spirits frolic during the ritual. You'd never think they could just as easily bury us all under a hail of snow.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_DARTORGOR_000_311<tab>(-Dartorgor-)The Pact is all that protects us from that fate, and soon I shall be its sole inheritor. Although I am young still, perhaps it's time to begin looking for a pupil.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_DARTORGOR_000_312<tab>(-Dartorgor-)Oh, I know! It could be <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var>, Fahrafahr! ...Haha, I jest, I jest!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_313<tab>That was our final conversation. On the way back, she suffered that terrible accident...

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_314<tab>Had we kept the memory of the Pact alive in Worlar's Echo...had we maintained the roads leading to and from the altar...then Dartorgor may still be with us. Her loss was a tragedy of indifference.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_100_314<tab>Yet the memory of her devotion gives me courage. That, and the presence of <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, who so bravely stood before Valigarmanda.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_315<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? <var 1A 02 /var>That<var 1A 01 /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_316<tab>You traveled from across the salt and risked life and limb for Tural...and if you can do that for us, I should not balk at doing the same.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_317<tab>But I am no fighter. If the spirits were to attack again, what would I do?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_A1_000_001<tab>Flee to Warmth─you'll be safe there.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_A1_000_002<tab>Hurl a few rocks at them!

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_319<tab>That indeed may be the wisest course of action. The spirits would be loath to enter a warm room, and their will may falter upon seeing so many Yok Huy gathered together.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_320<tab>Hah, spoken like a true warrior. However, it may be best to seek refuge rather than risk antagonizing the spirits further.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_100_320<tab>Ah, I know. What if you were to flee back to Warmth? The spirits would be loath to enter a warm room, and their will may falter upon seeing so many Yok Huy gathered together.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_321<tab>I think...I think I can manage with that. Very well, Fahrafahr, I shall return to the Hands.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_322<tab>Yet before I do, I must confess something. I was so flustered during my flight from the spirits that I dropped my most important tools. They are lost to the snows now, and I fear I cannot work without them...

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_323<tab>Well, you can see to that, right? Surely a set of stonemason's tools─chisels and the like─crafted by your hands will serve as a fine replacement for what Girzorhor lost. I shall provide you with all the materials you need.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_324<tab>Well, you can see to that, right? Surely a set of stonemason's tools─equipment for precise measuring and such─crafted by your hands will serve as a fine replacement for what Girzorhor lost. I shall provide you with all the materials you need.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_325<tab>Well, you can see to that, right? Surely a set of stonemason's tools─putty to repair cracks in stones and such─crafted by your hands will serve as a fine replacement for what Girzorhor lost. I shall provide you with all the materials you need.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_326<tab>I would be in your debt, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Once you've finished, please bring the tools to me and I will get back to work as soon as I can.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_330<tab>I look forward to seeing what tools your hands can create, but I know as well as anyone that perfection takes time. So, do not hesitate to ask Fahrafahr for more materials if you need them.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_345<tab>I have plenty of spare materials with me. If you run out, simply let me know.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_360<tab>I have no shortage of supplies, so feel free to try as many times as you need until you are satisfied with the result.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_400<tab>What do you have there? Might I have a closer look...?
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_401<tab>Ah hah! This is masterful work indeed! Even better than what I had before, in fact. Fahrafahr was right to put her trust in you─and I will follow suit.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_402<tab>Now, I should make good on my promise and get back to it. The workshop I build shall be worthy of these splendid tools.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_403<tab>Ah, nothing is more encouraging than seeing an artisan so eager to test his new equipment! Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_404<tab>I must return to Shelter to attend to my own work, but please stop by for a chat whenever you have a free moment.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_500<tab>I am overjoyed Girzorhor has returned. His absence would have been sorely felt.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_501<tab>In fact, I am beginning to think his ordeal was a blessing in disguise, for he works with even more zeal than before.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_502<tab>I was even able to tell a story of my time with Dartorgor, and in doing so give her the chance to lend her strength to the present. Nothing could make me happier.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_550<tab>Now that we can make traditional stonework here, we can use it in the buildings we repair, as well. And with each brick laid, we draw one step closer to completion.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_GIRZORHOR_000_551<tab>The patterns you see are among the oldest used by our people. Many depict scenes of us living side by side with the snow spirits, and making them has been quite the educational experience.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_000_552<tab>I only hope that Dartorgor is proud to see the progress we have made.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_FAHRAFAHR_100_552<tab>I shall continue to work and learn, for Dartorgor's sake. I encourage you to do the same, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_553<tab>The construction of Masons' Work has been completed, allowing for the creation of traditional Yok Huy stonework!
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_600<tab>You have achieved <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Trusted<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> reputation with the Hands of Zirgorteh.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_601<tab>Continue working with the Yok Huy to deepen your relationship.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_602<tab>New Yok Huy society daily quests are now available from Vuyargur in Shelter.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_603<tab>Furthermore, you will be able to undertake three additional quests from Vuyargur as a reputation bonus. This bonus is available until the daily reset time for allied society quests.

TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_604<tab>These additional quests will become available after accepting all current daily quests from Vuyargur. Please be advised that you cannot undertake these quests if you have no remaining allowances.
TEXT_BANYOK002_05331_SYSTEM_000_605<tab>You now have access to a wider selection of wares from Rarkorgor.
